intro: Actinostemma lobatum var. racemosum, commonly known as the racemose actinostemma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
